GameData:
- -
Are you trying to bother me? -
The answer is still no. The answer will remain no. -
Your persistence will not be rewarded. -
You return. -
You're back. -
Stop bothering me, I should be sleeping. -
You are making a very, very poor decision by continuing to bother me.
-
Good morning. Sleep well? -
Welcome back to the Garden of the Sun. -
Hello again. I trust you are enjoying the garden? -
Greetings. What do you want? -
What brings you here today? -
You're back. -
What is it you want this time? I've been bothered enough. -
You have an excess of guts and a deficit of sense to show your face to me. -
You again. I'm getting very tired of you. -
I would enjoy the appearance of imminent victory while I could, if I was you. It's the closest you'll get to the real thing. -
It's been a long time since I've had a foe as genuinely threatening as you to go against. You have my sincere thanks. -
I'm willing to negotiate your terms of surrender. -
It's time to end this destructive conflict. We've both proven what we sought to prove. -
I think we've obtained all we're going to from this war. -
A daring move, coming here. But I won't obliterate you here and save your people from the toils of war. I want a challenge. -
Go ahead. Get on your knees and beg for your life. -
Ah, it's you. Good. I was wondering if you had any last requests before your inevitable demise. -
Hello. How is our Research Agreement going, by the by? -
So, even after breaking your promises, you still show your face to me. Daring. I like it. -
Hello... friend. -
{1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} is becoming... quite an issue. -
I was going to ask if you were looking forward to obliterating {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} as much as I was. Then I realized, I don't think that's possible. -
Are you looking forward to obliterating {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} as much as I am? -
I'm enjoying your current conflict. Think of it as a prelude to the main event. -
Good morning. I hope your enemies are dying swiftly, but not too swiftly. -
I can't help but notice your aggressive military positioning against my borders. I'm looking forward to the day you stop pretending and declare war. -
My people have noticed your armies near my borders. If you're just passing through to get somewhere else, you probably want to hurry it up; they are demanding I fly out and slaughter them all so they can watch. -
I see you're aggressively settling cities to expand your frontiers right up next to mine. Thank you, it will save me the trouble of settling my own once I conquer them. -
I see you're aggressively settling cities to expand your frontiers right up next to mine. You have to know this will inevitably force us into war sooner or later. So, thanks in advance for the war! -
I see you buying up those plots of land near mine. I may have to just conquer them back. -
I see you buying up those plots of land near mine. How boring -- honestly, the fun way to expand would be to just come out and declare war! -
Hello. And let me just say, I love what you've done with your military. -
Your empire is famous for its strong economy. Which is very nice for you, but I always preferred being famous for my awe-inspiring might. -
You need to expand more! I want to be completely soaked in blood when I'm through annihilating you, and with so few cities, I'm not going to be able to get an even coating. -
You need to start developing more of an army, if you want this to be any sort of challemnge for me! -
My people are very afraid of you and what your warmongering plans mean for the safety of the world, and as their leader, I must share their concern. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But just between you and me, I love it, keep up the good work. -
What do you want? -
I have people to kill. What? -
You can apologize if you wish, but it won't make a difference. -
Wonderful. First I deal with that idiot {1_PlayerName}, and now you. -
Oh, you're {1_PlayerName}'s friend, aren't you? Hi. -
I see you've denounced {1_PlayerName}. Not your brightest move. -
You hate {1_PlayerName}? Me too! Let's start wrecking things! -
I don't even know you. -
Sorry. As muh as I appreciate offers of friendship, I can't let it seem like I open up easily. I have a reputation, you know. -
I'm denouncing {1_CivName} and I want you to join me. I think it's hilarious when someone realizes all their allies have abandoned them right before I reduse them to a greasy smear on the pages of history. -
I'm going to obliterate {1_CivName}. If you want front-row seats to the spectacle, you'll join my effort! (WILL DECLARE WAR IMMEDIATELY) -
Oh. So that's what friendship means to you? I... well, I probably would have done the same.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
If that's how you want it, I'm just going to warn the others that you're next on my list.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Clearly, I am not as good at this whole "friendship" thing as I thought, because I offered it to a fool like you. Might as well warn the others not to make the same mistake. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
You just publically announced your disapproval of the most powerful, terrifying youkai in the world. You have some nerve. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I like it. -
So I hear you've been talking smack about me to the other leaders. Now, I wonder which is more powerful... your diplomatic influence, or the Master Spark fired down your throat? So many questions. -
I see you've declared friendship with {1_CivName}. Maybe I ought to do the same? -
You declared friendship with {1_CivName}? Well, whatever you hoped to gain from that alliance, you had better get it out of them quick. -
You denounced my friends, {1_CivName}. I'm actually angrier at that than if you had denounced me. -
Glad to see you hate {1_CivName}. Less people will complain to me when I destroy them. -
So, you allied with {1_CivName}, just like I did. Is it too early to declare the three of us the axis upon which the world will now turn? -
Good to see you're on board with denouncing {1_CivName}. The looks on their faces as they realize all their allies are deserting them will be priceless. -
Friends with {1_CivName}? Makes it easier to make my list of what order to destroy everyone in. -
You denounced my friends, {1_CivName}. I'm actually angrier at that than if you had denounced me.
-
I see you're aggressively settling cities to expand your frontiers right up next to mine. You have to know this will inevitably force us into war sooner or later. Which I am not opposed to, but felt I should warn you about. -
Did you just lie to me about not expanding near my territory just so I would go away? Come on, if you're going to lie, have some style about it! -
I see you buying up those plots of land near mine. If you keep it up, you will force us into war. I hope you keep it up. -
I see you buying up those plots of land near mine. If you keep it up, you will force us into war. -
Did you just lie to me about not expanding near my territory just so I would go away? Come on, if you're going to lie, have some style about it! -
If you've noticed that the tribute you're recieving from city-states has gone down lately, that would be because I'm wiping one of your puny little allies off the face of the Earth. Get used to it. -
I just found out that one of the weaklings I'm erasing from existence happened to be your ally. I'm sorry, but in my defense, if they didn't want to be Master Sparked into oblivion then they should have built their city farther away from me. -
Wait a second, Pacts of Cooperation were patched out of the game! Hax! I call hax! -
I feel like extending the umbrella of my protection to a few deserving civilizations. Would you care to sign a formal Declaration of Friendship? -
I hate you, and I feel like telling the world. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
You're terrible, and soon you will be dead, and soon after that you will be forgotten. I'm informing the rest of the world so we can get this over with quickly. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]She has publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Warmonger (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Citystates (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Taking all the land (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Wonders (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Victory Conditions (shouldn't appear) -
Pact of Cooperation end - Timeout (shouldn't appear) -
{1_PlayerName:textkey} Pact of Secrecy (shouldn't appear) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Will not cause you to declare war) -
{1_PlayerName:textkey} Pact of Secrecy end (shouldn't appear) -
I'm thinking of tearing {1_PlayerName:textkey} into pieces. You in? -
Blah blah blah, threat to the stability of the world, blah blah let's go murder {1_PlayerName:textkey} already. -
It's time to annihilate {1_PlayerName:textkey}! I've been very careful these past ten turns to leave some bits for you to destroy too. -
All right, there's a lot I'm willing to put up with. Lies, murder, genocide, devastating magical lasers, pantsuits -- but you've just crossed a line! -
Now we're enemies. And that means danmaku! -
I think our alliance has benefitted us both greatly. We haven't quite annihilated everyone who opposes us, but, hey, always room for improvement. -
I found some fairies travelling through the Garden of the Sun. I told them "Come here and PLAY with me, children!" and they all screamed and ran. I'm never gonna get to open this Settlers of Catan box, am I? -
"Danger Level: Extremely High. Human Friendship Level: The Worst." You know, Akyuu didn't even interview me for that. She just made it up. I can have friends... if someone will just give me a chance... -
My people are very afraid of you and what your warmongering plans mean for the safety of the world, and as their leader, I must share their concern. But just between you and me, I love it, keep up the good work. -
I see you over there, trying to weasel your way in between me and {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. I'd knock that off if I were you.
-
All you shrine maidens look alike. Maybe that's why you keep dying your hair, so you can tell each other apart. -
Is that what you always look like or have you started making out with Elly's scythe? -
I don't know who told you you can pull off those shoes, but they lied to you. -
Your military is pathetic. I wouldn't even need a single spell card. -
With my new nuclear arsenal, I now have the ability to press a single button and reduce a city into a hellstorm of flaming nothingness. So, like the Master Spark, only I don't have to get out of bed. -
I know I intimidate lesser empires into giving me what I want, but... it's just tasteless when I see you doing it. Have some panache about it! -
I live in a garden of horrors beneath a lake of blood, and your civilization is STILL the most depressing place I have ever seen. -
You need to expand more! I want to be completely soaked in blood when I'm through annihilating you, and with so few cities, I'm not going to be able to get an even coating. -
You need to increase your population more! With as few citizens as you have, butchering them all wouldn't even be a massacre, it would barely count as a kerfuffle! -
Your civilization is a bleak, dreary place. Where's the joy? Where's the culture? I have half a mind to come over and terrorize your people, because at least that inspires SOME kind of emotion!
-
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} announces to the world that it is now protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. Attacking the City-State will greatly damage relations and may lead to war. -
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
-
No. -
Very well. The borders of my garden won't approach yours. -
No. You're more than welcome to try and stop my expansion by force, but I won't listen to mere words. -
Friendship? An officially declared friendship? I... Sure, I guess I can try that out. -
Pass. -
I don't feel like it. -
This is a Pact of Secrecy line so it shouldn't appear. -
Let's do this thing. -
I'd love to join along with your -- or any -- war. Give me ten turns or so to arrange my armies together, okay? -
I feel like rewarding audacity. Just don't try my patience. -
You've got guts, I'll give you that. And... Heck, I'll give you what you wanted, too! -
Hahahaha! Oh, you are just [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]precious[ENDCOLOR]. -
Aww, look! It thinks it's people! -
You want it? Take it from me. -
I only respond to the language of power. That was the language of whining. -
You've got guts, I'll give you that. But nothing else. -
Not a chance in hell. -
If you're going to pretend to have amnesia, I may as well give you the savage beating that goes along with it. -
Go away, you bother me.
-
... -
Beating on you has become tiresome. Let's end this war, so I can start a newer, better one with someone else. -
I'm bored of this war. Will this end it? -
I offer a fair trade. You give me these items, and in exchange, I won't Master Spark you into oblivion. -
Are you using these? I could use a hand. -
I need some more resources to cultivate the growth of my civilization. I will repay you in the future, I promise. -
I noticed I had more than I needed. Since I already blew up my last surplus, I figured I would give it to someone else. -
Here. Have a gift. I like to keep people guessing. -
Opening our borders will help both our cultural and military development. I'd welcome your citizens, just stay away from the sunflowers! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Seriously though, if they damage the sunflowers I will kill them. -
I want to plan to make a Research Agreement later. But I don't think this text ever actually appears.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](Agreeing will not form a Research Agreement yet) -
I'd like to commission a Research Agreement between us. I need to develop new Spell Cards, and nobody in my civilization will let me practice on them any more. -
This deal's nearly dried up. Let's water it again, shall we? -
This deal's nearly dried up, and I'll need more from your end if you want to save it.
-
I'll take it! -
Why, thank you! -
Splendid! -
I accept. -
That'll do. -
Good enough. -
Dang. I was half-hoping you'd say no so we could fight about it. -
That's what I thought. -
Oh, all right, fine. I guess I'll alllow you to concede. -
I need more than that. -
Completely unacceptable. -
No way. -
You must think that either you are very clever or I am very stupid. -
Ha ha, real funny, what was your real offer? -
That looks fine to me already. -
That works for me if it works for you. -
I require more supplies to cultivate my civilization. How does this trade look? -
How's this look? -
I can't think of any way to make that work. -
Nothing can make that work.
-
Oh, this does not end well for you. -
I'm going to reduce you to a mist of atoms. -
You have just thrown your life away. -
If you take me lightly, then... well, I suppose you're going to see what happens. -
Now, the sleeping terror awakens! -
Your kind are so full of yourselves. If you wanted to live a nice full life, you should have been a lot more quiet about it. -
I'm going to paint a mural in your blood. I'm thinking... some happy flowers. -
Were you hoping you could outmaneuver my superior forces? Power is everything. Now it will be the last thing you learn. -
You certainly have guts. For that, I'll kill you quickly. -
A-hahahaha... Ahhh... I'm going to wear your skin. -
Ooh! Thanks, I was getting bored with all this peace! -
Try not to die too quick now, or it won't be any fun! -
All right! Finally, something I can deal with: wholesale slaughter! -
It looks like it's time to start blazing a trail of blood and annihilation right to your doorstep! -
I suppose it always has to be this way, doesn't it? Nobody could truly be my friend. I will always be alone. -
Hm... if Yuuka the killer is all the world can see, then I suppose that is what I must give them. -
Betrayal! Murderous betrayal, trying to get me to open my heart in friendship, so you can drive a stake into it![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]...I love it!
-
Let's play "Genocide". [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] You're "it". -
I am impressed you have managed to live this long. I suppose that means it's time for me to get serious. -
How many Master Sparks does it take to get to the juicy center of a civilization? Let's find out! -
Hoping to impress me with your constant lies? Well, it's working, but I'm declaring war anyway. -
You're in my way. Time to remedy that. -
My people need to expand ever outward and claim more lands! As good a reason as any to declare a war, I think. -
All right, now I think it's time I fought you all at once and conquered the entire world. Then, I think I'll let everyone rebuild so I can do it again. Then, lunch. -
Think you're ready to stop my dreams of world conquest? I'm expecting a good effort from you, don't let the rest of the world down! -
Yeah, it's probably time I stomped on your neck. -
Time to clean you up. You're just a distraction from the real battles, anyway. -
Roses are red. [NEWLINE]Violets are blue. [NEWLINE]Omae wa mo [NEWLINE]Shindeiru. -
You have me on the ropes; your units are more numerous, better armed, better trained, more advanced... At last, an exciting challenge! -
I'm not really having fun until I can taste blood and I'm not sure whose it is. Let's do this thing! -
So long, sucker! -
"Betrayal". It's... actually, it's a lovely word. I love how it rolls off the tongue. "Betrayal". Rich and dark, like chocolate. Anyway, I'm going to kill you now. -
Your forces appear superior, but I don't see any options other than war... No, that isn't right. I see plenty of other options. They just aren't as fun. -
I know this probably doesn't mean much, coming from me, but... if I'd seen any way through this other than war, I would have taken it. Sorry. -
I'm sorry that it has to be this way, but... it has to be this way. Let's get this over with quickly. -
And now, in a plot twist foreseen by every single person smarter than you, I am declaring war on you for your insolence.
-
Go ahead. Get on your knees and beg for your life. -
I want to hear you admit how badly I've beaten you. Then, maybe I'll stop. -
Try me. Maybe I'm feeling generous! -
Eh... I suppose. -
Well, I guess the war had to end eventually. -
I don't think you understand who you are dealing with. I cannot be bargained with. I cannot be reasoned with. I do not feel pity, or remorse, or fear. -
I'm not ending this war until I've had my fun! -
This war just started! Barely anyone even died!
-
Excellent. -
This is good. -
Neat. -
Thank you. -
Appreciate it! -
Thanks. -
That's a shame. -
Well, that's no good. -
I'm not mad, but I am disappointed. -
All right then. -
Very well. -
You will regret this. -
Thanks for returning my captured civilians. Truth be told, I'm not too good at rescue missions. There's never anything left to rescue once I'm done. -
I hope you realize how ironic it will be when I take that land back and use your new citadel to hold off your feeble attempts to reclaim it. -
If you wanna start a war, there's easier ways to do it! -
Ha! You got guts, I'll give you that! -
Oh. I'm actually a bit disappointed. -
Ha! You got guts, I'll give you that. -
Oh. I'm actually a bit disappointed. -
Try and stop me. No, really, go ahead, you'll be more of a challenge than your little friend. -
That's what I thought. -
Bah, if they were really worth caring about, they wouldn't be so weak and squishable! -
How predictable. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
Did you decide? -
Okay, good. Glad we got that out of the way. -
My words are now backed by nuclear weapons! Which are basically like Master Spark weapons, but I don't have to split myself in two to use them remotely. That always gives me a headache.
-
I'm pleased to see someone else following the path of Freedom. 'Do what thou wilt' should be the whole of the law, shouldn't it? -
Greetings comrade! I'm pleased to see you also have chosen to follow the path of Order. Civilization is a garden, one that must be painstakingly cultivated and weeded to reach its full potential. -
Excellent, you have chosen the path of Autocracy. Power is the only thing that matters in this world. Glad to see someone else understands that. -
I caught one of your little spies in my home, trying to steal my technology. If they keep it up, they're going to discover the secrets of the Dual Spark, firsthand. -
I really, really can't overstate what a bad idea sending your spies into my home is. It didn't work out that well for the shrine maiden and the black-white, and it's going to work out even worse for your people. -
Good. I was really sick of being woken up by spies. -
No wonder you need to keep sending people to gather intelligence for you. You don't have any of your own. -
Ugh, okay, I'll pull the spies back. -
No. I'm not just about destruction, you know, I'm also about deception, so I need to keep spying or I'll lose my rep. -
Oh-ho-ho! Now we'll be ready for whatever that {@1_CivAdjective} plan can throw at us. It's gonna be great! -
Darling little Wriggle informs me that {1_PlayerName} is plotting against you. What you do with this information is up to you, but I hope it's violent. -
Darling little Wriggle informs me that {1_PlayerName} is preparing to attack {2_CityName}. If you find out anything interesting, keep me informed, would you? -
Darling little Wriggle informs me that {1_PlayerName} is preparing to attack you. She didn't say where the army was going, apparently bugs aren't very good with directions. -
Darling little Wriggle informs me that {1_PlayerName} is preparing a naval assault against {2_CityName}. If you find out anything interesting, keep me informed, would you? -
Darling little Wriggle informs me that {1_PlayerName} is preparing a naval assault against you. She didn't say where the navy was going, apparently bugs aren't very good with directions. -
I caught your spy tring to steal from us. Here's a matchbox with the remains. -
I just found out that -- without my approval -- my gatekeeper Elly was caught attempting to steal technology from one of your cities. I understand if you're upset, but I hope you won't hold all of us responsible for the actions of one bad apple. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] ...Get it? -
I can guess where this is going. Espionage, right? -
I just noticed that several research reports have gone missing, your technology has unexpectedly advanced, and now Kurumi suddenly has a very fancy, expensive hat! You wouldn't think those were related, would you? -
I'm getting very tired of you sending your missionaries into my borders. Mainly because every time they look at me, they start screaming about how the ultimate evil has arrived and all is lost. -
Yeah, I expected as much. -
See? A little espionage isn't so bad. -
Thank you. More preaching was the last thing I needed. -
Fantastic. On top of everything else, you're a religious fanatic. -
I will try and direct the missionaries and preachers to go run off somewhere else rather than bother you. -
Sorry, but I simply can't stop the missionaries traveling to your lands. Any time I try to talk to them, they run away screaming about the Devil; I can't tell them anything! -
Get down on your knees and beg for your life, and I'll be merciful. -
I'm willing to accept your surrender now. If I totally wipe you out, who will be left to tell the story of how I destroyed you?
-
Ha. Just try and stop me. -
That's what I thought. -
Bah, if they were really worth caring about, they wouldn't be so weak and fearful! -
Glad you understand how these things work. -
I'd make an offer, but anything I could give would be a rip-off for you. -
I can't give you what that's worth.
